(cat "Go to " (sysGetName 'C5) " and find Hugo Sandoval. He flies a heavily modified Armstrong-class transport.

" "System: " (sysGetName 'C5) "
" "Payment: None" )

(list { desc: (cat "Fiona brings up a starmap on her datapad.

"
""I'm going to need your help. Go to the " (sysGetName 'C5) " system and " "get in touch with Hugo Sandoval. He's a friend of mine. He's a merc, but " "I can trust him.

"
""Together you should be able to find the wreckage of Sister Ston's medical " "ship. Perhaps we'll scrape off a clue."" )
acceptLabel: ""[I]'m on my way."" declineLabel: ""[L]et me prepare first."" } )

You enter the brightly lit central garden of the New Victoria University Hospital. Recovering patients sit on articulated gurneys, while doctors and medtechs pass through, heads buried in datapads.
Nearby, Fiona rests at a bench, hooked up to a medical bot:
"I'm glad to finally meet you. Thank you for saving my life in %systemName%."

Fiona looks around and engages a privacy screen.
"Look, I don't know you, OK? Thanks again, but everything is fine."

Fiona blinks tears away and looks down.
"You don't want to get involved, OK?"
She pauses for a long time, but seeing your persistence she shakes her head and sighs. A fresh scar curves under her left eye and disappears behind her ear.

"A few months ago, one of our medical ships, the Hand of Solace, was ambushed and wrecked by marauders. Sister Elana Ston was in command at the time, and she survived along with a medtech. Later, the medtech was found dead—blasted, actually.
"Sister Ston thought the medtech might have been involved with the marauders and then betrayed by them."

"Yeah, I know it doesn't make sense, OK? But I couldn't find any other explanation. And the Hand of Solace was gone, so there was no evidence.
"But then I got a strange message."

Fiona arches an eyebrow, impressed.
"Yes! He said it wasn't marauders. He told me to look for the wreckage of the medical ship in the %systemName% system. Asked to tell him what I found.
"But I never got there. Penitents attacked me on my way and here I am."

Fiona stares at you.
"No. Not yet. Stormhound told me about his past. I'm questioning everything, OK?"

Fiona closes her eyes and smiles.
"I want to believe that, OK? I really do. But I can't take the chance that I'm wrong."

Fiona closes her eyes and frowns.
"I don't know anymore. But either way, I can't take the chance that he's turned."
Language.String: "Alright, but don't take long. Something tells me we don't have much time."
Language.Text: "Something tells me we don't have much time. The sooner you reach Sandoval, the better!"
